documenttitle.text: Red Hat Security Advisory: webkit2gtk3 security update

note.text:
An update for webkit2gtk3 is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
note.title: Topic

note.text:
WebKitGTK is the port of the portable web rendering engine WebKit to the GTK platform.

Security Fix(es):

* WebKitGTK: Regression of CVE-2023-28205 fixes in the Red Hat Enterprise Linux (CVE-2023-2203)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
note.title: Details

documentdistribution.text: Copyright Â© 2023 Red Hat, Inc. All rights reserved.

note.text: A flaw was found in the WebKitGTK package. An improper input validation issue may lead to a use-after-free vulnerability. This flaw allows attackers with network access to pass specially crafted web content files, causing a denial of service or arbitrary code execution. This CVE exists because of a CVE-2023-28205 security regression for the WebKitGTK package in Red Hat Enterprise Linux 9.2.
note.title: Vulnerability Description

description.text:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

reference.Description: bz#2188543: Regression of CVE-2023-28205 fixes in the Red Hat Enterprise Linux

fullproductname.text: webkit2gtk3-0:2.38.5-1.el9_2.1 as a component of Red Hat Enterprise Linux AppStream (v. 9)
